undefined To Titus, my genuine son in a common faith. Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior!Titus’ Task on Crete
undefined The reason I left you in Crete was to set in order the remaining matters and to ap-point elders in every town, as I directed you.
undefined An elder must be blameless, the husband of one wife, with faithful children who cannot be charged with dissipation or rebellion.
undefined For the overseer must be blameless as one en-trusted with God’s work, not arrogant, not prone to anger, not a drunkard, not violent, not greedy for gain.
undefined Instead he must be hospi-table, devoted to what is good, sensible, up-right, devout, and self-controlled.
undefined He must hold firmly to the faithful message as it has been taught, so that he will be able to give exhortation in such healthy teaching and cor-rect those who speak against it.
undefined For there are many rebellious people, idle talkers, and deceivers, especially those with Jewish connections,
undefined who must be silenced because they mislead whole families by teaching for dishonest gain what ought not to be taught.
undefined A certain one of them, in fact, one of their own prophets, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”
undefined Such testimony is true. For this reason rebuke them sharply that they may be healthy in the faith
undefined and not pay attention to Jew-ish myths and commands of people who reject the truth.
undefined All is pure to those who are pure. But to those who are corrupt and unbe-lieving, nothing is pure, but both their minds and consciences are corrupted.
undefined They pro-fess to know God but with their deeds they deny him, since they are detestable, disobedi-ent, and unfit for any good deed.Conduct Consistent with Sound Teaching
But as for you, communicate the be-havior that goes with sound teaching.
undefined Old-er men are to be temperate, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, and in en-durance.
undefined Older women likewise are to ex-hibit behavior fitting for those who are holy, not slandering, not slaves to excessive drink-ing, but teaching what is good.
undefined In this way they will train the younger women to love their husbands, to love their children,
undefined to be self-controlled, pure, fulfilling their duties at home, kind, being subject to their own husbands, so that the message of God may not be discredit-ed.
undefined Encourage younger men likewise to be self-controlled,
undefined showing yourself to be an example of good works in every way. In your teaching show integrity, dignity,
undefined and a sound message that cannot be criticized, so that any opponent will be at a loss, because he has nothing evil to say about us.
undefined Slaves are to be subject to their own masters in every-thing, to do what is wanted and not talk back,
undefined not pilfering, but showing all good faith, in order to bring credit to the teaching of God our Savior in everything.
undefined For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all people.
undefined It trains us to reject godless ways and worldly desires and to live self-controlled, upright, and godly lives in the present age,
undefined as we wait for the happy fulfillment of our hope in the glorious appearing of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ.
undefined He gave himself for us to set us free from every kind of lawlessness and to purify for himself a people who are truly his, who are eager to do good.

Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work.
undefined They must not slander anyone, but be peaceable, gentle, showing complete courtesy to all people.

undefined When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
undefined Make every effort to help Zenas the law-yer and Apollos on their way; make sure they have what they need.
undefined Here is another way that our people can learn to engage in good works to meet pressing needs and so not be unfruitful.
